title: One of Europe's busiest airports to cap passengers through early 2023
description: Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport -- one of Europe's busiest -- announced plans Thursday to continue capping the number of travelers departing from the airport through early 2023.

title: US officials troubled by controversial UK tax cut plan
description: US officials are increasingly troubled by the United Kingdom's proposal to slash taxes at a time of crushing inflation, a plan that has ignited turbulence in financial markets.

title: Webb telescope spies a celestial sparkler among the universe's earliest galaxies
description: The very first image captured by the James Webb Space Telescope is revealing some of the oldest stars and galaxies in the universe, including one that looks like a sparkler, according to new research.

title: Scenes from the unimaginable destruction of Hurricane Ian
description: Hurricane Ian shredded the roof of a Port Charlotte intensive care unit, flooding the hospital ward and turning a stairwell into a waterfall.

title: More than 200,000 people have left Russia since Putin's mobilization announcement, collective data shows
See TikTok users' curious replacement for the cheese board
description: Have you eaten off a "butter board" yet? CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on a food trend that's literally spreading.

title: US Army doctor and anesthesiologist charged with conspiring to provide US military medical records to Russian government
description: A wife and husband from Maryland have been charged with conspiring to provide the Russian government with personal medical records from the US government and military, according to a newly unsealed federal indictment.

title: Brazil's presidential vote is just days away. Voters are comparing it to 'war'
description: Brazil's upcoming presidential election has been shrouded by an unprecedented climate of tension and violence. As the Oct. 2 vote approaches, episodes of harassment and attacks have intensified, with even neutral players like poll institutes turning into targets.

title: Webb, Hubble space telescopes share images of DART slamming into an asteroid
description: Two of the most powerful telescopes in space watched as a NASA spacecraft intentionally slammed into an asteroid this week.

title: Rift in Danish royal family after Queen strips four grandchildren of royal titles
description: A rift has emerged in the Danish royal family following a decision by Queen Margrethe to strip four of her eight grandchildren of their royal titles in order to "future-proof" the monarchy.

title: NASA spacecraft will fly by an ocean world orbiting Jupiter
description: A NASA spacecraft will fly by one of the most intriguing ocean worlds in our solar system on Thursday.

title: Wolf Blitzer goes on journey after learning his grandparents were murdered at death camp
description: After finding documents revealing new family history, CNN's Wolf Blitzer makes a trip to Auschwitz on a journey of reflection and discovery.

title: Analysis: Why Putin is annexing Ukrainian territory
description: President Vladimir Putin is set to sign agreements Friday that will absorb into Russia thousands of square miles of Ukrainian territory in what will be the largest forcible annexation of land in Europe since 1945.

title: Trial of 87-year-old Rwanda genocide suspect Félicien Kabuga opens at The Hague
description: The trial of one of the last fugitives accused of broadcasting hateful propaganda and arming militias in the 1994 Rwanda genocide has opened at a United Nations court in The Hague.

title: Trust in the Supreme Court is at a record low
description: Less than half of Americans said they have either a "great deal" or a "fair amount" of trust in the judicial branch that is headed by the Supreme Court, according to new polling from Gallup. That's the lowest that number has been since Gallup starting measuring the trend five decades ago and speaks to how damaging the court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade this past summer has been to its overall reputation with the public.

title: Brittney Griner's former college coach Kim Mulkey faces criticism over refusal to comment on basketball star's detainment in Russia
description: Kim Mulkey, who coached Brittney Griner for four years at Baylor University, is facing criticism over her refusal to comment on her former player's detainment in Russia at a media conference earlier this week.

title: Brett Favre's latest scandal revives debate about how Black and White athletes are treated differently
description: A version of this story appeared in CNN's Race Deconstructed newsletter. To get it in your inbox every week, sign up for free here.

title: Top Hannity radio producer sought Trump meeting to present fraud 'proof,' new book says
description: In early January 2021, during the politically turbulent time before Joe Biden assumed the office of the presidency, the executive producer of Sean Hannity's radio show sought to meet directly with then-President Donald Trump.

title: Ahead of the midterm elections many Latinos don't see a difference in what Democrats and Republicans stand for
description: While more Latinos say Democrats work hard to earn their votes than Republicans, about half of them don't see a "great deal of difference" in what the two political parties stand for, a new poll shows.

title: Reporter wades into floodwaters to save stranded nurse
description: CNN affiliate WESH reporter Tony Atkins waded into flooding caused by Hurricane Ian to rescue a stranded nurse caught by the rising waters on her way to work.

title: They fell in love in Mexico in 1981. Four months later she was diagnosed with cancer
description: Annie MacDonald was waiting in a long line at a small bank in the coastal city of Zihuatanejo, Mexico when she first laid eyes on Steven Berger.

title: Here's how to get your hands on a piece of an Airbus A380
description: There's nothing quite like keeping a memento of the one you loved, and if the one in question is the Airbus A380, you're in luck.

title: Queen Elizabeth II died of old age, death certificate shows
description: Queen Elizabeth II died of old age, her death certificate has revealed.

title: 'Hocus Pocus 2' conjures the same old brew in a Disney+ revival
description: Disney regularly wrings inordinate mileage out of nostalgia, which can easily obscure when the source wasn't quite as worthy of praise as we like to remember. "Hocus Pocus 2" should benefit from that dynamic, delivering a breezy sequel -- 29 years later -- that should provide go-down-easy Halloween viewing for families in the less-demanding confines of Disney+.

title: Khloe Kardashian turned down Tristan Thompson's proposal
description: More has been revealed about Khloe Kardashian and Tristan Thompson's former relationship.

title: Virtual body-shaming: Why the metaverse won't fix our IRL beauty standards
description: Avatars are nothing new — and nor is the idea that we care about how we look online.

title: Why stores start selling Christmas stuff in September
description: You may not be anywhere close to ready for the holidays — but retail chains certainly are.

title: Alito on SCOTUS critics: 'Questioning our integrity crosses an important line'
description: Justice Samuel Alito says criticism of the Supreme Court is going too far.

title: Latest GDP reading confirms the US economy shrank for two straight quarters, supporting one definition of a recession
description: The US economy shrank by 0.6% during the second quarter of the year, according to the latest gross domestic product estimate from the Bureau of Economic Analysis released Thursday.

title: Nigeria's Abubakar launches presidential bid to to save country from 'frightening descent' into anarchy
description: Nigeria's main opposition leader Atiku Abubakar launched his presidential election campaign on Wednesday calling for a sweeping victory to save the country from a "frightening descent" into anarchy.

title: Reporter hit by tree branch while covering Hurricane Ian
description: Weather Channel reporter, Jim Cantore, was struck by the fallen tree branch while reporting live inside Hurricane Ian.

title: The UK is gripped by an economic crisis of its own making
description: A week ago, the Bank of England took a stab in the dark. It raised interest rates by a relatively modest half a percentage point to tackle inflation. It couldn't know the scale of the storm that was about to break.

title: The bond market is crumbling. That's bad for Wall Street and Main Street
description: The global bond market is having a historically awful year.

title: Biden to host first ever US-Pacific Island Country Summit
description: President Joe Biden is hosting the first ever US-Pacific Island Country Summit this week, a multi-day event in Washington focused on cooperation with the United States' countries in the Pacific region.

title: Annexation move follows referendums dismissed as a sham
description: The Kremlin will host a ceremony on Friday at which agreements will be signed on the entry of occupied Ukrainian territories to the Russian Federation, President Vladimir Putin's spokesman told reporters on Thursday.

title: Nord Stream gas ruptures could leak 'unprecedented' amount of this potent greenhouse gas
description: Experts say that the unexplained explosions in the Nord Stream pipelines running from Russia to Europe could release an "unprecedented" amount of the greenhouse gas methane and be enormously damaging to the climate.

title: US and Europe condemn 'sabotage' of pipeline
description: The US and Europe are closing ranks, signaling to Moscow their unity over the war in Ukraine won't be shattered by what they say is the "sabotage" of dual undersea gas pipelines that could represent a possible new front in energy warfare.

title: Porsche shares gain 5% in Frankfurt stock market debut
description: Shares of Porsche gained as much as 5% on their stock market debut in Frankfurt after Volkswagen spun out the premium sports car maker in one of Europe's biggest listings on record.

title: NBA stars LeBron James, Kevin Love and Draymond Green agree to buy pickleball team
description: Yes, you read the headline correctly.

title: Trump pushing back on special master's request for him to declare in court whether DOJ inventory is accurate
description: Former President Donald Trump is pushing back against a plan from the special master overseeing the review of documents seized from Mar-a-Lago that would require Trump to declare in court whether the Justice Department's inventory from the search is accurate.

title: Ex-English Premier League player summoned to fight for Russia
description: Former Everton and Russian national team soccer player Diniyar Bilyaletdinov received a summons from Russia's military registration and enlistment office, his father, Rinat Bilyaletdinov, told Russian state news agency RIA Novosti.

title: Qatar World Cup organizers dispute Denmark kit manufacturer's claims of human rights abuses
description: Qatar World Cup organizers disputed Denmark kit manufacturer Hummel's claims of human rights violations in the host country following the unveiling of the Danish kits the country will wear at this year's tournament.

title: Taiwan's giant panda 'Tuan Tuan' has life-threatening brain disease. China has been asked to help
description: China's famous 'Panda diplomacy' faces a test -- after a bear in Taiwan came down with a life-threatening brain lesion.

title: Coffee lowers risk of heart problems and early death, study says, especially ground and caffeinated
description: Drinking two to three cups a day of most types of coffee may protect you from cardiovascular disease and an early death, a new study found.

title: Russia to annex four occupied Ukrainian regions at Kremlin ceremony on Friday
Tampa Bay Buccaneers practice in Miami and talk about Hurricane Ian impact; Minneapolis selected as contingency site for Sunday's game
description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers practiced for the first time in Miami on Wednesday having relocated to south Florida as Hurricane Ian made landfall.

title: Behind the 'raw' photo of Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal that captures their enduring friendship
description: It was a moment in time -- as brief as half a second -- that captured the intensity of the relationship and rivalry of Roger Federer and Rafa Nadal.

title: Hear one woman recount the 'scariest' moment under Russian occupation
description: As Ukrainian forces make further gains in the eastern region of Donetsk, CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports from a newly-liberated monastery town in the region, where local residents spent seven months underground while Russian forces occupied their homes.

title: The 'raw' photo of Federer and Nadal which captures their enduring friendship
description: Photographer Ella Ling speaks to Don Riddell about the "raw" photo she took of Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal holding hands at the Laver Cup after the final match of Federer's career.

title: The family of Hae Min Lee is appealing a judge's decision to vacate the murder conviction of Adnan Syed
description: The family of Hae Min Lee is appealing a Maryland judge's decision to vacate the murder conviction of Adnan Syed, who was accused of killing the teen and served more than 20 years in prison before his release last week, according to a court document filed Wednesday.

title: Monster storm floods streets and homes, uproots trees, sends cars floating in streets and traps residents
description: As Hurricane Ian continues to pummel Florida, trapping residents in their homes and leaving millions without power in what's already being called a "life-changing event," authorities are urging residents to take shelter hours after it made landfall.

title: Hong Kong wins over Wall Street CEOs after lifting strict Covid rules
description: Hong Kong has finally secured commitments from some of the world's biggest banks to participate in a long-awaited summit, as it seeks to reaffirm its status as a global financial hub.

title: Europe officials observed Russian Navy ships in vicinity of Nord Stream pipeline leaks
description:
• Live: Fourth leak in Nord Stream found 
• 'The worst is yet to come': Russians rush to borders amid draft fears

title: Myanmar court sentences Aung San Suu Kyi and Australian economist to 3 years in prison
description: A Myanmar military court has sentenced ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi and her former adviser to three years in prison for violating the country's Official State Secrets Act, a source familiar with the court proceedings confirmed to CNN.

title: Hurricane is unleashing catastrophic floods and life-threatening storm surge that will continue as storm advances inland
Hurricane Ian makes landfall in Florida
The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine
'The worst is yet to come': Russians rush to the borders amid draft fears
description:
• Live: Fourth leak in Nord Stream found 
• Europe officials observed Russian Navy ships in vicinity of Nord Stream leaks

title: China's yuan hovers near record lows against the dollar despite central bank warning
description: China's yuan hovered near record lows against the US dollar on the offshore market on Thursday, as major currencies around the world continue to tumble after the Federal Reserve's aggressive hikes.

title: Hear what economist thinks British government should do
description: Britain's economic prospects have soured significantly after Prime Minister Liz Truss's government announced to slash 48 billion dollars worth of unfunded taxes. CNN's Nina dos Santos reports.

title: Timelapse shows hurricane storm surge flood streets in Fort Myers
description: New timelapse video from a web camera in Fort Myers, Florida, shows the storm surge from Hurricane Ian flooding the city's streets.

title: Kamala Harris to visit DMZ amid tension over North Korean missile launch
description: US Vice President Kamala Harris will visit the Demilitarized Zone that divides North and South Korea on Thursday -- one day after Pyongyang fired two ballistic missiles into the waters off its east coast.

title: 15,000 kilometers by boat, train, car and on foot: Highlights of a caffeine-fueled journey through Indonesia
description: Even after traveling extensively through Indonesia for more than two decades, I sometimes struggle to grasp the true scale and diversity of the biggest island nation on the planet.

title: My 5-year-old daughter just confirmed our decision to leave China
description: When word began circulating on social media and in group chats in mid-September that one of China's top health officials was warning citizens to avoid physical contact with foreigners as a precaution against monkeypox, the news hit me with an unshakable anxiousness.

title: CNN reporter walks around destroyed home after Hurricane Ian
description: CNN's Brian Todd shows a home in Largo, Florida, that was destroyed when neighbors say a power line snapped during Hurricane Ian.

title: New York Yankees slugger Aaron Judge hits 61st home run to tie Roger Maris' 61-year-old record
description: New York Yankees slugger Aaron Judge hit his 61st home run Wednesday, tying Roger Maris' single-season American League home run record Sunday, set in 1961.

title: Cow dung speakers and dog hair rugs: Innovative upcycling at Singapore Design Week
description: Southeast Asia has a waste problem. The region accounts for half of the 10 countries in which the most plastic pollution leaks into rivers and seas, according to the World Bank. And in addition to their own production, countries like Malaysia and Vietnam are among the leading importers of consumer waste from the developed world.

title: Coolio, 'Gangsta's Paradise' rapper, dead at 59
description: Coolio, the '90s rapper who lit up the music charts with hits like "Gangsta's Paradise" and "Fantastic Voyage," has died, his friend and manager Jarez Posey, told CNN. He was 59.

title: Why this flight was hurricane hunter's 'roughest'
description: NOAA Aerospace Engineer Nick Underwood flew a plane into Hurricane Ian. He shares his experience with the storm with CNN's Erin Burnett.

title: European security officials observed Russian Navy ships in vicinity of Nord Stream pipeline leaks
Check out Amazon's new sleep tracker and Kindle you can write on
description: Amazon debuted a series of new devices and software updates, including a bedside sleep tracker, a Kindle you can write on, and new software for its home robot that allows it to monitor pets.

title: Ryan Reynolds teases iconic Marvel character making a comeback in 'Deadpool 3'
description: Ryan Reynolds made a big announcement about the highly anticipated 'Deadpool 3', entering the Marvel Cinematic Universe with one of the most well-known superheroes of all time.

title: SE Cupp: Why Republicans don't have the courage to stand up to Trump
description: According to recent reporting, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and former President Donald Trump might not have the cozy relationship their public appearances indicate. In this week's episode of "Unfiltered," SE Cupp looks at why Republicans only have the courage to criticize Trump privately.
